Scenario Description:
To verify that the Merit plans are configured correctly: 
- Targets hidden/overridden 
- Applicable profiles 
- Eligibility Rules 
- Statutory Minimum 
- Waiting Period 
- Compensation Matrix 
- Time Proration Rule 
- Rounding Rule
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp plans". Click on the Merit tab. From the Merit tab, select the applicable Merit Plan(s) to review.

Scenario Description: To verify that any specified security groups cannot see targets
Task / Step: Proxy as a member of the designated security group. Navigate to their own worker profile. View Compensation tab on the worker record and ensure target is not visible

Scenario Description:
To verify that the Bonus plans are configured correctly: 
- Targets hidden/overridden 
- Applicable profiles 
- Eligibility Rules 
- Waiting Period 
- Time Proration Rule 
- Rounding Rule 
- Scorecards 
- Performance Factors
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp plans". Click on the Bonus tab. From the Bonus tab, select the applicable Bonus Plan(s) to review.

Scenario Description: To verify that any specified security groups cannot see targets.
Task / Step: Proxy as a member of the designated security group. Navigate to their own worker profile. View Compensation tab on the worker record and ensure target is not visible.

Scenario Description:
To verify that the Stock plans are configured correctly: 
- Targets hidden/overridden 
- Applicable profiles 
- Eligibility Rules 
- Rounding Rule 
- Defaults
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp plans". Click on the Stock tab. From the Stock tab, select the applicable Stock Plan(s) to review.

Scenario Description: To verify that any specified security groups cannot see targets
Task / Step: Proxy as a member of the designated security group. Navigate to their own worker profile. View Compensation tab on the worker record and ensure target is not visible

Scenario Description: Update compensation package to contain relevant bonus, merit, or stock plans
Task / Step: Search: "Edit Comp Pack". Click Edit Compensation Package

Scenario Description: Verify the plan will include the correct employee population.
Task / Step: While in each plan, right click on the eligibility rule.  Select "open in new tab". Use related actions to "View Eligible Workers".

Scenario Description: Verify the plan is configured properly: will prorate the award.
Task / Step: While in each plan, right click on the proration rule.  Select "open in new tab".

Scenario Description: Verify the plan is configured properly: will round the award.
Task / Step: While in each plan, right click on the rounding rule.  Select "open in new tab".

Scenario Description: Verify the plan is configured properly: employees will be subject to the correct waiting period.
Task / Step: While in each Bonus and Merit plan, right click on the waiting period. Select "open in new tab".
Sub Task: Verify if employees in the waiting period will be included in the process - checkbox on plan. If waiting period employees are included in the process, they'll come in with a zero target

Scenario Description: Verify the correct scorecard goal(s) and profile(s) are configured.
Task / Step: While in each Bonus plan, right click on the scorecard(s) (i.e. Company Funding Scorecard, Plan Modifier Scorecard, and/or Performance Factors). Select "open in new tab".
Sub Task: If there are scorecard profiles, verify the goals and eligibility rules on each profile.

Scenario Description: Verify the compensation matrix (matrices) are configured correctly.
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp mat"   Click on Compensation Matrix.  Review your Compensation Matrix (Matrices)

Scenario Description: Review the stock grant types and confirm they are configured as per requirements.
Task / Step: Search bar: "Stock Grant Type"

Scenario Description: Review the stock vesting schedule and confirm they are configured as per requirements.
Task / Step: Search bar: "Stock Vest Sched"

Scenario Description: Review Compensation Planner Assignments (if not using managers as planners)
Task / Step: Search bar: "View Security Group", enter security group that is the Planner group in the review process

Scenario Description:
Log on as various users you would expect to be able to Propose/View the Compensation Review Process. While logged on as these users, search for Process tasks/reports and verify that security groups and permissions have been assigned to the right users.
Controller: Compensation Administrator
Participant: Manager
Reviewer: HR Partner
A compensation review process must be open for these reports to return any results.
Task / Step: Proxy as an employee who is assigned one of the roles you want to check in the scenario description.

Scenario Description: Review the validation rules for Merit, Bonus, Stock, Allowance, Commission and Organization and confirm they are all configured as per requirements. NOTE: New Validation Rules cannot be added once a compensation review process has begun; only existing rules can be edited.
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp valid " Click on Maintain Compensation Review Validations. Click on each one listed.

Scenario Description: Review configuration of compensation participation rule sets for each date parameter and award type
Task / Step: Search bar: "Comp Rev Partic Rule Set". Click on Maintain Compensation Review Participation Rule Sets

Scenario Description: Review the Compensation Review Template and confirm it is configured as per requirements.
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp rev opt". Click on View Compensation Review Options. Click on each one listed.

Scenario Description: Review the Compensation Review Template and confirm it is configured as per requirements.
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp rev tem" Click on Compensation Review Template. Click on each one listed.

Scenario Name: Initiate Compensation Review Business Process Definition
Scenario Description: Review the Initiate Compensation Review Business Process and confirm it is configured as per requirements.
Task / Step: Search bar: "BP: Initiate Compensation Review". Review the steps

Scenario Name: Promotions in Merit - Validate Rule Based Change Job Business Process
Scenario Description: Review the Rule Based Change Job Business Process and confirm it is configured as per requirements.
Confirm the compensation review statement you are planning to use is configured. If you are creating a customized layout, make sure this is configured with a delivered layout for testing purposes.
Task / Step: Search bar: "compensation review rule" Click on View Compensation Review Statement Rule. Enter today's date as the effective date. Select active Compensation Review Statement.

Scenario Description: Initiate the Hire process for a new employee. Make sure Merit, Bonus, and Stock Plans with appropriate targets are defaulting correctly. After completing the process, repeat as necessary to verify that any other compensation eligibility rules behave as expected. Discuss this test scenario with HCM stream as the process will include additional steps that are not relevant to Advanced Compensation.
Task / Step:
Navigate to the Employee Profile   
Select: Action Button > Compensation > Request Compensation Change
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: Initiate the Request Compensation Change process for an employee. Ensure you can add/edit/delete various Merit, Bonus, and Stock plans or targets as appropriate. After completing the process, repeat as necessary to verify that any other compensation eligibility rules behave as expected. Take note of approval routings as applicable and confirm process.
Task / Step: Employee Profile   Select: Action Button > Compensation > Request Compensation Change
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: Initiate the Change Job process for an employee. Make sure Merit, Bonus, and Stock Plans with appropriate targets are defaulting correctly. After completing the process, repeat as necessary to verify that any other compensation eligibility rules behave as expected. Discuss this test scenario with HCM stream as the process will include additional steps that are not relevant to Advanced Compensation.
Task / Step: Employee Profile Select: Action Button > Job Change > Transfer, Promote or Change Job
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: Initiate the Request/Add Stock Grant process for an employee.
Task / Step: Comp Admin: Employee Profile    Select: Action Button > Compensation > Add Stock Grant
Sub Task: Manager: Employee Profile    Select: Action Button > Compensation > Request Stock Grant
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5.2 Bonus and Stock Allocation

Scenario Description: Manually create eligible earnings overrides for employees (including editing an existing EEO).
Task / Step: Search bar: "Create Eligible Earnings Override Period" Create a period in alignment with your process period.
Sub Task: For a small population, create eligible earnings manually in Workday. Search bar: "Create Eligible Earnings Override" Enter the employee and the period Enter the earnings for the employee and which Bonus Plans it applies to.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.6.1.2 Maintain and administer employee earnings information

Scenario Description: If using a template, verify that information defaults correctly from the Compensation Review Process Template. Review all available fields and options that can be edited.
Task / Step: Enter "initiate comp" in the search at top left and select Initiate Compensation Review Process. Complete the relevant fields.
Sub Task: Visibility Date: Date the increase will be visible to the employee. Use if visibility is after the effective date.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: Choose rules. Click on Manage Employee Participation. Review impacted employees and send notifications if applicable.
Task / Step: Manage Impacted Employees. Submit when done.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: Complete fields on page or accept default values. If promotions, additional adjustments, or lump sum payments are included, either select to deduct from merit pool or create separate pools.
Task / Step: Configure Pools. Submit when done.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: If applicable, make changes to pool amounts on organizations. Note this is an optional step in the business process so will only appear if configured.
Task / Step: Distribute Pools. Submit when done.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: Launch the Compensation Review Process.
Task / Step: Select the Launch button.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: Log into Workday as a Compensation Administrator (Controller) and go to the Inbox to view each Launched Process Control Page. Review available information and actions.
Task / Step: Task in Controller's inbox.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: Log into Workday as the Participant who proposes awards (Planner) and go to the Inbox to view the launched process task.
Task / Step: Task in Planner's inbox. Click the "Propose" pencil icon to go into the Configurable grid.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: Verify that the Promotions tab is available in the configurable grid, including all relevant editable fields
Task / Step: Task in Planner's inbox. Click the "Propose" pencil icon to go into the Configurable grid.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Name: Finalize Cycle - Work with your functional consultant before actioning this scenario
Scenario Description:
Finalize: wait until all other items have passed prior to finalizing a cycle. 

In order to cancel an existing cycle, use Mass Cancel. Choose "Initiate Compensation Review" as the Business Process Type, click on "Include Subprocesses", click OK. Click "Select All" and click on OK. Click Confirm, then click OK, to cancel. If you don't have access to Mass Cancel, use Related Action > Business Process > Cancel from the process in the Control inbox task.
Task / Step: Task in Controllers inbox on the Control Page. Click the Finalize Button.
Sub Task: If a visibility date was added, verify the employee cannot view their merit increase and bonus payments before the visibility date.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Name: Validate that worker's record is updated
Scenario Description: Validate that worker's compensation record is updated after finalization
If stock is in cycle, Update Stock Grants to mark the awards from the cycle as "Board Approved"
Release Compensation Review Statement
Task / Step: Enter fields on Release Compensation Review Statement page. Choose rule. Choose delivery date/time.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review

Scenario Description: Set Compensation Review Statement Visibility

Scenario Description: Review Compensation Review Statement for employee as the Compensation Admin
Task / Step: Navigate off of the employee's profile > Compensation > View Compensation Review Statement History.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review

Scenario Name: Review Compensation Review Statement as Manager
Scenario Description: Review Compensation Review Statement
Task / Step: Proxy in as Manager, navigate off of the employee's profile > Compensation > View Compensation Review Statement History.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review

Scenario Name: Review Compensation Review Statement as Employee
Scenario Description: Review Compensation Review Statement
Task / Step: Proxy in as employee, navigate off of the employee's profile > Compensation > View Compensation Review Statement History.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review

Scenario Description:
Log on as various users you would expect to be able to Propose/View the Compensation Review Process. While logged on as these users, search for Process tasks/reports and verify that security groups and permissions have been assigned to the right users.
Controller: Compensation Administrator
Participant: Manager
Reviewer: HR Partner
Task / Step: Proxy as an employee who is assigned one of the roles you want to check in the scenario description.

Test Type: 2 | End to End Tenant Build Validation
Scenario Description: Log into Workday as a Compensation Administrator and start a rollout process for Merit, Bonus, and Stock Plans (separately or in any combination, it's important to run several processes). This process allows you to assign Compensation Plans to multiple employees without approval steps. Make sure the Effective Date is aligned with the Compensation Review Process you are going to initiate. Note: if an employee was not eligible (e.g. not yet hired) for the plan on the effective date of the rollout, they will not receive the plan assignment. Compensation rollouts should only be used if every worker should receive the plan as of the same effective date.  If unique effective dates are necessary, then opt for assigning plans via EIB.
Task / Step: Search "Rollout Comp". Enter the required fields including the effective date and the compensation plans to rollout. Include any eligibility rules or employees to specify rollout to a specific population, if applicable. Click OK. Refresh to complete.
Sub Task: Search Rollout Comp and select to View Compensation Plan Rollout Process.  View the employees receiving AND not receiving Compensation Plan. The number of employees is hyperlinked.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Test Type: 2 | End to End Tenant Build Validation
Scenario Description:
Log into Workday as a Compensation Administrator and navigate to the Employee Compensation Audit report to review employee audiences for plans. This report evaluates plan eligibility rules and lists employees incorrectly assigned to plans or missing plan assignments.

Navigate to the Extract Employee Compensation Details report to review employee merit, bonus, and stock plan assignments.
Task / Step:
Employee Compensation Audit

Extract Employee Compensation Details
Sub Task: Search: Employee Compensation Audit  Select the highest supervisory org and check the include all subordinates box (Optional: Use the exclude feature to exclude all non-merit, bonus and stock plans. Review employees within the list

Scenario Description: Initiate the Request/Add Stock Grant process for an employee.
Task / Step: Comp Admin: Employee Profile Select: Action Button > Compensation > Add Stock Grant
Sub Task: Manager: Employee Profile Select: Action Button > Compensation > Request Stock Grant
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5.2 Bonus and Stock Allocation

Scenario Description: Work with your functional consultant on using EIBs to load employee earnings calculated outside of Workday. This needs to be completed prior to launching and testing the compensation review process.
Task / Step: Search bar: "Create Eligible Earnings Override Period" Create a period in alignment with your process period.
Sub Task: For a small population, create eligible earnings manually in Workday. Search bar: "Create Eligible Earnings Override" Enter the employee and the period Enter the earnings for the employee and which Bonus Plans it applies to.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.6.1.2 Maintain and administer employee earnings information

Scenario Description: If using a template, verify that information defaults correctly from the Compensation Review Process Template. Review all available fields and options that can be edited.
Task / Step:
Enter "initiate comp" in the search at top left and select Initiate Compensation Review Process. Complete the relevant fields.

Effective Date - Enter date that the increases should take effect. 
Process Period End Date: If process/review period is 5/1 to 4/30, enter 4/30/20xx 
Organization Snapshot Date: Enter the date that the system should evaluate the reporting structure. This date is usually the same as the Effective Date. 
Template: Choose the applicable template. Grid configuration and plans should default.
Click "OK". On page 2 entered an identifiable process name in Name. Verify the defaulted information, change if needed, click "Submit".
Sub Task: Visibility Date: Date the bonus will be visible to the employee. Use if visibility is after the effective date.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Description: Choose rules. Click on Manage Employee Participation. Review impacted employees and send notifications if applicable.
Task / Step: Manage Impacted Employees. Submit when done.

Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.1.3.2.1 Develop salary/compensation structure and plan

Scenario Name: Auditing Proposals: Compensation Review Process View Organization
Scenario Description: A Reviewer of the process can use this task to view/modify an organization like a manager.

Sub Task: Find and run this task using the compensation dashboard

Scenario Name: Auditing Proposals: Compensation Review Process Search Employees
Scenario Description: A Reviewer of the process can use this task to select employees using filters and view/modify their awards in a grid.

Sub Task: Find and run this task using the compensation dashboard

Scenario Name: Terminate an Employee in the Process
Scenario Description: While the compensation review process is open, process an employee termination to observe impact on their participation.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Name: Job and Compensation Change for Employees in the Process
Scenario Description:
While the compensation review process is open, process job and compensation changes to observe impact on employees' participation and calculations. Test changes effective before and after the compensation snapshot date.

Note blackout periods.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.2.4.2.5.1 Administer compensation and rewards to employees

Scenario Name: Promotions in Merit - Promotion without Review
Scenario Description: Promote an employee in the compensation review process. Set the Promote flag to "Yes", and complete staffing and compensation details. Do not flag the promotion for review. Once the compensation review process is completed, verify the Change Job process is automatically completed. Verify the updated promotion details on the employee's profile, including correct assignment of appropriate compensation plans.
Task / Step: Login as the Reviewer of the process to review the process.   Search bar: "Comp Rev Org"
Sub Task: Find and run this task using the compensation dashboard
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review

Scenario Name: Promotions in Merit - Promotion with Review
Scenario Description: Promote an employee in the compensation review process. Set the Promote flag to Yes, and complete staffing and compensation details. Flag the promotion for review prior to finalizing. Once the compensation review process is completed, verify the Change Job process is routed for review and approval. Ensure that appropriate compensation plans default correctly, and that you can add/remove plans and adjust targets as needed. Verify the updated promotion details on the employee's profile.
Task / Step: Login as the Reviewer/Controller of the process to review the process.   Search: "Comp Rev Search"
Sub Task: Find and run this task using the compensation dashboard
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review

Scenario Name: Run delivered reports when cycle is open; after cycle is completed.
Scenario Description:
Confirm that appropriate users can run delivered report(s) when cycle is open and when cycle is finalized.  If Configured use the Compensation Review Dashboard to run these reports.  Example of these delivered reports start with "Compensation Review," here are some examples:

"Compensation Review Calculations - Employee Details"
"Compensation Review Awards On Hold Audit"
"Compensation Review Employee Changes Audit"
"View Bonus Calculation"
"Review Promotions in Merit"
Task / Step: Before and After Finalization
Workday Role:
Run as planner
Run as Compensation Partner 
Run as Compensation Administrator
Business Process Alignment (Detailed):
1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review
1.5.5.2 Bonus and Stock Allocation

Scenario Name: Validate that worker's compensation record is updated after finalization
Scenario Description: Review worker's record after cycle finalization. Confirm that worker record is updated where relevant e.g. Salary/Hourly increase; Bonus Award; OTP Award; Update to bonus/allowance/commission targets.
Business Process Alignment (Level 2):
1.3 Reward to Retain
1.5 Develop to Perform
Business Process Alignment (Level 3):
1.3.1 Develop and manage reward, recognition, and motivation programs
1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review
Business Process Alignment (Detailed):
1.1.3.2.1 Develop salary/compensation structure and plan
1.5.5.2 Bonus and Stock Allocation

Scenario Description: If promotions in the cycle were marked for review, complete the Change Job Transactions
If stock is in cycle, Update Stock Grants to mark the awards from the cycle as "Board" Approved
Release Compensation Review Statement
Task / Step: Enter fields on Release Compensation Review Statement page. Choose rule. Choose delivery date/time.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review

Scenario Description: Set Compensation Review Statement Visibility

Scenario Name: Review Compensation Review Statement as Manager
Scenario Description: Review Compensation Review Statement
Task / Step: Proxy in as Manager, navigate off of the employee's profile > Compensation > View Compensation Review Statement History.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review

Scenario Name: Review Compensation Review Statement as Employee
Scenario Description: Review Compensation Review Statement
Task / Step: Proxy in as employee, navigate off of the employee's profile > Compensation > View Compensation Review Statement History.
Business Process Alignment (Detailed): 1.5.5 Perform Annual Compensation Review

Scenario Description:
To verify that the Merit plans are configured correctly: 
- Targets hidden/overridden 
- Applicable profiles 
- Eligibility Rules 
- Statutory Minimum 
- Waiting Period 
- Compensation Matrix 
- Time Proration Rule 
- Rounding Rule
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp plans". Click on the Merit tab. From the Merit tab, select the applicable Merit Plan(s) to review.

Scenario Description:
To verify that the Bonus plans are configured correctly: 
- Targets hidden/overridden 
- Applicable profiles 
- Eligibility Rules 
- Waiting Period 
- Time Proration Rule 
- Rounding Rule 
- Scorecards 
- Performance Factors
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp plans". Click on the Bonus tab. From the Bonus tab, select the applicable Bonus Plan(s) to review.

Scenario Description:
To verify that the Stock plans are configured correctly: 
- Targets hidden/overridden 
- Applicable profiles 
- Eligibility Rules 
- Rounding Rule 
- Defaults
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp plans". Click on the Stock tab. From the Stock tab, select the applicable Stock Plan(s) to review.

Scenario Description: Verify the plan will include the correct employee population.
Task / Step: While in each plan, right click on the eligibility rule. Select "open in new tab".

Scenario Description: Verify the plan is configured properly: will prorate the award.
Task / Step: While in each plan, right click on the proration rule. Select "open in new tab".

Scenario Description: Verify the plan is configured properly: will round the award.
Task / Step: While in each plan, right click on the rounding rule. Select "open in new tab".

Scenario Description: Verify the plan is configured properly: employees will be subject to the correct waiting period.
Task / Step: While in each Bonus and Merit plan, right click on the waiting period. Select "open in new tab".
Sub Task: Verify if employees in the waiting period will be included in the process - checkbox on plan

Scenario Description: Verify the correct scorecard goal(s) and profile(s) are configured.
Task / Step: While in each Bonus plan, right click on the scorecard(s) (i.e. Company Funding Scorecard, Plan Modifier Scorecard, and/or Performance Factors). Select "open in new tab".
Sub Task: If there are scorecard profiles, verify the goals and eligibility rules on each profile.

Scenario Description: Verify the compensation matrix (matrices) are configured correctly.
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp mat"   Click on Compensation Matrix.  Review your Compensation Matrix (Matrices)

Scenario Description: Review the validation rules for Merit, Bonus, Stock, Allowance, Commission. and Organization. Confirm the rules and validation messages are configured  per requirements.
Task / Step: Search bar: "comp valid " Click on Maintain Compensation Review Validations. Click on each one listed.

Scenario Description: Confirm the compensation review statement you are planning to use is configured. If you are creating a customized layout, make sure this is configured with a delivered layout for testing purposes.
Task / Step: Search bar: "compensation review rule" Click on View Compensation Review Statement Rule. Enter today's date as the effective date. Select active Compensation Review Statement

Scenario Description: Review the stock grant types and confirm they are configured as per requirements.
Task / Step: Search bar: "Stock Grant Type"

Scenario Description: Review the stock vesting schedule and confirm they are configured as per requirements.
Task / Step: Search bar: "Stock Vest Sched"

Scenario Description:
Log on as various users you would expect to be able to Propose/View the Compensation Review Process. While logged on as these users, search for Process tasks/reports and verify that security groups and permissions have been assigned to the right users.
Controller: Compensation Administrator
Participant: Manager
Reviewer: HR Partner
Task / Step: Proxy as an employee who is assigned one of the roles you want to check in the scenario description.

Scenario Description:
Log into Workday as a Compensation Administrator and navigate to the Employee Compensation Audit report to review employee audiences for plans. This report evaluates plan eligibility rules and lists employees incorrectly assigned to plans or missing plan assignments.

Navigate to the Extract Employee Compensation Details report to review employee merit, bonus, and stock plan assignments.
Task / Step:
Employee Compensation Audit

Extract Employee Compensation Details
Sub Task: Search: Employee Compensation Audit  Select the highest supervisory org and check the include all subordinates box (Optional: Use the exclude feature to exclude all non-merit, bonus and stock plans. Review employees within the list

Scenario Description: ***Perform this test in a COPY of Gold tenant only*** If using a template, verify that information defaults correctly from the Compensation Review Process Template. Review all available fields and options that can be edited.
Task / Step: Enter "initiate comp" in the search at top left and select Initiate Compensation Review Process. Complete the relevant fields.
Sub Task: Visibility Date: Date the increase will be visible to the employee. Use if visibility is after the effective date.

Scenario Description: ***Perform this test in a COPY of Gold tenant only*** Choose rules. Click on Manage Employee Participation. Review impacted employees and send notifications if applicable.
Task / Step: Manage Impacted Employees. Submit when done.

Scenario Description: ***Perform this test in a COPY of Gold tenant only*** Complete fields on page or accept default values.
Task / Step: Configure Pools. Submit when done.

Scenario Description: ***Perform this test in a COPY of Gold tenant only*** If applicable, make changes to pool amounts on organizations. Note this is an optional step in the business process so will only appear if configured.
Task / Step: Distribute Pools. Submit when done.

Scenario Description: ***Perform this test in a COPY of Gold tenant only*** Launch the Compensation Review Process.
Task / Step: Select the Launch button.

Scenario Description: ***Perform this test in a COPY of Gold tenant only*** Log into Workday as a Compensation Administrator (Controller) and go to the Inbox to view each Launched Process Control Page. Review available information and actions.
Task / Step: Task in Controller's inbox.

Scenario Description: ***Perform this test in a COPY of Gold tenant only*** Log into Workday as the Participant who proposes awards (Manager) and go to the Inbox to view the launched process task.
Task / Step: Task in Manager's inbox. Click the "Propose" pencil icon to go into the Configurable grid.

Scenario Name: Finalize Cycle - Work with your functional consultant before actioning this scenario
Scenario Description:
***Perform this test in a COPY of Gold tenant only*** Finalize: wait until all other items have passed prior to finalizing a cycle. 

In order to cancel an existing cycle, use Mass Cancel. Choose "Initiate Compensation Review" as the Business Process Type, click on "Include Subprocesses", click OK. Click "Select All" and click on OK. Click Confirm, then click OK, to cancel. If you don't have access to Mass Cancel, use Related Action > Business Process > Cancel from the process in the Control inbox task.
Task / Step: Task in Controllers inbox on the Control Page. Click the Finalize Button.
Sub Task: If a visibility date was added, verify the employee cannot view their merit increase before the visibility date.
